item.title: [DERBY-250] With client setObject( parameterIndex, x, java.sql.DOUBLE) throws conversion exception if the object passed is a BigDecimal with more than 31 digits

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
For these calls the API doc says:

The given Java object will be converted to the given targetSqlType before being sent to the database

Converting the values on the client prior to sending them to the server eliminates the error. I will post a patch with this change.

Applied Kathey's patch

Sending java\client\org\apache\derby\client\am\PreparedStatement.java
Sending java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\master\DerbyNet\jdk15\prepStmt.out
Sending java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\master\DerbyNetClient\jdk15\prepStmt.out
Sending java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\master\prepStmt.out
Sending java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\tests\derbynet\prepStmt.java

Transmitting file data .......
Committed revision 167863.

This issue was fixed with svn r167863

Below are the patch comments.

This is a patch for Derby-250 to eliminate the conversion error when a
BigDecimal with more than 31 digits is passed to setObject with a targetSqlType.
public void setObject(int parameterIndex,
Object x,
int targetSqlType)
throws SQLException
or
public void setObject(int parameterIndex,
Object x,
int targetSqlType,
int scale)
throws SQLException

The approach of the patch is to have setObject calls with a targetSqlType to always convert before sending to the value to the server for all types.

Taking this approach exposed other issues with the client's conversion mechanism for Date, Time and Timestamp, which were customized valueOf methods to support ISO format. Since the extended format is not needed for Derby, I replaced these with the
standard <Date|Time|TimeStamp>.valueOf calls.

The patch also fixes issues with scale getting set properly when specified for these calls.
